name: py-pybind11

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

variants.name: generator
variants.description: the build system generator to use

description:
pybind11 -- Seamless operability between C++11 and Python. pybind11 is a
lightweight header-only library that exposes C++ types in Python and
vice versa, mainly to create Python bindings of existing C++ code. Its
goals and syntax are similar to the excellent Boost.Python library by
David Abrahams: to minimize boilerplate code in traditional extension
modules by inferring type information using compile-time introspection.

dependencies.name: cmake
dependencies.description:
A cross-platform, open-source build system. CMake is a family of tools
designed to build, test and package software.

dependencies.name: gmake
dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.

dependencies.name: ninja
dependencies.description:
Ninja is a small build system with a focus on speed. It differs from
other build systems in two major respects: it is designed to have its
input files generated by a higher-level build system, and it is designed
to run builds as fast as possible.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-pytest
dependencies.description: pytest: simple powerful testing with Python.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependent_to.name: acts
dependent_to.description:
A Common Tracking Software (Acts) This project contains an experiment-
independent set of track reconstruction tools. The main philosophy is to
provide high-level track reconstruction modules that can be used for any
tracking detector. The description of the tracking detector's geometry
is optimized for efficient navigation and quick extrapolation of tracks.
Converters for several common geometry description languages exist.
Having a highly performant, yet largely customizable implementation of
track reconstruction algorithms was a primary objective for the design
of this toolset. Additionally, the applicability to real-life HEP
experiments plays major role in the development process. Apart from
algorithmic code, this project also provides an event data model for the
description of track parameters and measurements. Key features of this
project include: tracking geometry description which can be constructed
from TGeo, DD4Hep, or GDML input, simple and efficient event data model,
performant and highly flexible algorithms for track propagation and
fitting, basic seed finding algorithms.

dependent_to.name: py-pyspoa
dependent_to.description: Python bindings to spoa

dependent_to.name: py-torch-nvidia-apex
dependent_to.description:
A PyTorch Extension: Tools for easy mixed precision and distributed
training in Pytorch

dependent_to.name: reprimand
dependent_to.description:
RePrimAnd: Recovery of Primitives And EOS framework RePrimAnd is a
support library for numerical simulations of general relativistic
magnetohydrodynamics. It provides methods for recovering primitive
variables like pressure and velocity from the variables evolved in
quasi-conservative formulations. Further, it provides a general
framework for handling matter equations of state.

dependent_to.name: py-amrex
dependent_to.description: AMReX Python Bindings with pybind11

dependent_to.name: py-gmxapi
dependent_to.description:
Python bindings and ensemble workflow management for GROMACS. The
GROMACS C++ API is affected by its package variants. You can specify a
particular GROMACS API by making the dependency variant explicit. E.g.
``spack install gmxapi ^gromacs+mpi~double``

dependent_to.name: sparrow
dependent_to.description:
Sparrow: fast semiempirical quantum chemical calculations. When
publishing results obtained with Sparrow, please cite the corresponding
release as archived on Zenodo (DOI 10.5281/zenodo.3244105; please use
the DOI of the respective release). In addition, we kindly request you
to cite the following article when using Sparrow: T. Husch, A. C.
Vaucher, M. Reiher, "Semiempirical molecular orbital models based on the
neglect of diatomic differential overlap approximation", Int. J. Quantum
Chem., 2018, 118, e25799.

dependent_to.name: odgi
dependent_to.description:
Optimized dynamic genome/graph implementation. Odgi provides an
efficient and succinct dynamic DNA sequence graph model, as well as a
host of algorithms that allow the use of such graphs in bioinformatic
analyses.

dependent_to.name: scine-utilities
dependent_to.description: Contains functionality which is used in most SCINE modules.

dependent_to.name: scine-readuct
dependent_to.description:
ReaDuct allows you to carry out structure optimizations, transition
state searches and intrinsic reaction coordinate (IRC) calculations
among other things

dependent_to.name: open3d
dependent_to.description: Open3D: A Modern Library for 3D Data Processing.

dependent_to.name: autodiff
dependent_to.description: autodiff is automatic differentiation made easier for C++.

dependent_to.name: openpmd-api
dependent_to.description: C++ & Python API for Scientific I/O

dependent_to.name: py-torchtext
dependent_to.description: Text utilities, models, transforms, and datasets for PyTorch.

dependent_to.name: py-qdldl
dependent_to.description:
Python interface to the QDLDL free LDL factorization routine for quasi-
definite linear systems: Ax = b.

dependent_to.name: serenity
dependent_to.description: Subsystem focused quantum chemistry code Serenity

dependent_to.name: py-scipy
dependent_to.description: Fundamental algorithms for scientific computing in Python.

dependent_to.name: easi
dependent_to.description:
easi is a library for the Easy Initialization of models in three (or
less or more) dimensional domains.

dependent_to.name: py-torchaudio
dependent_to.description: An audio package for PyTorch.

dependent_to.name: py-pyomo
dependent_to.description:
Pyomo is a Python-based open-source software package that supports a
diverse set of optimization capabilities for formulating and analyzing
optimization models.

dependent_to.name: py-hmmlearn
dependent_to.description:
hmmlearn is a set of algorithms for unsupervised learning and inference
of Hidden Markov Models.

dependent_to.name: akantu
dependent_to.description:
Akantu means a little element in Kinyarwanda, a Bantu language. From
now on it is also an opensource object-oriented Finite Element library
which has the ambition to be generic and efficient.

dependent_to.name: py-projectq
dependent_to.description:
ProjectQ is an open-source software framework for quantum computing
started at ETH Zurich. It allows users to implement their quantum
programs in Python using a powerful and intuitive syntax. ProjectQ can
then translate these programs to any type of back-end, be it a simulator
run on a classical computer of an actual quantum chip.

dependent_to.name: xtensor-python
dependent_to.description: Python bindings for the xtensor C++ multi-dimensional array library

dependent_to.name: freecad
dependent_to.description:
FreeCAD is an open-source parametric 3D modeler made primarily to design
real-life objects of any size. Parametric modeling allows you to easily
modify your design by going back into your model history to change its
parameters.

dependent_to.name: singularity-eos
dependent_to.description:
Singularity-EOS: A collection of closure models and tools useful for
multiphysics codes.

dependent_to.name: tamaas
dependent_to.description:
Tamaas is a C++ library with a Python interface that efficiently solves
contact mechanics problems with periodic rough surfaces, plasticity,
adhesion and friction.

dependent_to.name: sirius
dependent_to.description: Domain specific library for electronic structure calculations

dependent_to.name: py-fenics-dolfinx
dependent_to.description:
Python interface to the next generation FEniCS problem solving
environment

dependent_to.name: py-onnxruntime
dependent_to.description:
ONNX Runtime is a performance-focused complete scoring engine for Open
Neural Network Exchange (ONNX) models, with an open extensible
architecture to continually address the latest developments in AI and
Deep Learning. ONNX Runtime stays up to date with the ONNX standard with
complete implementation of all ONNX operators, and supports all ONNX
releases (1.2+) with both future and backwards compatibility.

dependent_to.name: py-contourpy
dependent_to.description: Python library for calculating contours of 2D quadrilateral grids.

dependent_to.name: py-torchdata
dependent_to.description: Composable data loading modules for PyTorch.

dependent_to.name: py-fenics-basix
dependent_to.description:
Python interface to Basix, a finite element definition and tabulation
runtime library

dependent_to.name: scine-molassembler
dependent_to.description: Chemoinformatics toolkit with support for inorganic molecules.

dependent_to.name: py-torch
dependent_to.description:
Tensors and Dynamic neural networks in Python with strong GPU
acceleration.

dependent_to.name: py-dlio-profiler-py
dependent_to.description:
A low-level profiler for capture I/O calls from deep learning
applications.

dependent_to.name: py-pyamg
dependent_to.description:
PyAMG is a library of Algebraic Multigrid (AMG) solvers with a
convenient Python interface.

dependent_to.name: migraphx
dependent_to.description: AMD's graph optimization engine.

dependent_to.name: py-correctionlib
dependent_to.description: A generic correction library

dependent_to.name: py-smartredis
dependent_to.description: A Python Interface for the SmartRedis Library Client

dependent_to.name: py-matplotlib
dependent_to.description:
Matplotlib is a comprehensive library for creating static, animated, and
interactive visualizations in Python.

dependent_to.name: xcdf
dependent_to.description:
Binary data format designed to store data fields with user-specified
accuracy.

dependent_to.name: py-pysimdjson
dependent_to.description:
Python bindings for the simdjson project, a SIMD-accelerated JSON
parser. If SIMD instructions are unavailable a fallback parser is used,
making pysimdjson safe to use anywhere.

dependent_to.name: trilinos
dependent_to.description:
The Trilinos Project is an effort to develop algorithms and enabling
technologies within an object-oriented software framework for the
solution of large-scale, complex multi-physics engineering and
scientific problems. A unique design feature of Trilinos is its focus on
packages.

dependent_to.name: py-ml-dtypes
dependent_to.description:
A stand-alone implementation of several NumPy dtype extensions used in
machine learning libraries.

dependent_to.name: py-qiskit-aer
dependent_to.description:
Aer is a high performance simulator for quantum circuits that includes
noise models

dependent_to.name: py-pyopencl
dependent_to.description: Python wrapper for OpenCL.

dependent_to.name: py-spdlog
dependent_to.description:
The py-spdlog package provides a Python wrapper to the C++ spdlog
library.

dependent_to.name: py-httpstan
dependent_to.description: HTTP-based REST interface to Stan, a package for Bayesian inference.

dependent_to.name: py-meshpy
dependent_to.description: Simplicial Mesh Generation from Python

dependent_to.name: xyce
dependent_to.description:
Xyce (rhymes with 'spice') is an open source, SPICE-compatible, high-
performance analog circuit simulator, Xyce supports the standard
analysis capabilities found in other SPICE-like codes, such as DC,
transient, AC, and small-signal noise analyses; it also has less common
capabilities, such as harmonic balance, sensitivity analysis, and
uncertainty propagation techniques. Xyce supplies industry-standard
compact models and can support custom models via its Verilog-A model
compiler. Foundry process-development kits (PDKs) in other SPICE syntax
can be used via the XDM netlist translator, which is included as part of
the Xyce package. In addition to supporting use on all common desktop
platforms (Mac, Windows, Linux), Xyce can also be compiled to run in a
large-scale parallel mode to provide scalable, numerically accurate
analog simulation of circuits containing millions of devices, or more.

dependent_to.name: py-optree
dependent_to.description: Optimized PyTree Utilities.

dependent_to.name: py-awkward
dependent_to.description: Manipulate JSON-like data with NumPy-like idioms.

dependent_to.name: py-minkowskiengine
dependent_to.description:
The MinkowskiEngine is an auto-differentiation library for sparse
tensors.

dependent_to.name: py-pykokkos-base
dependent_to.description:
Minimal set of bindings for Kokkos interoperability with Python
(initialize, finalize, View, DynRankView, Kokkos-tools)

dependent_to.name: py-mapbox-earcut
dependent_to.description:
Python bindings for the C++ implementation of the Mapbox Earcut library,
which provides very fast and quite robust triangulation of 2D polygons.

dependent_to.name: arbor
dependent_to.description:
Arbor is a high-performance library for computational neuroscience
simulations.

dependent_to.name: xcfun
dependent_to.description: Exchange-Correlation functionals with arbitrary order derivatives.

dependent_to.name: py-scikit-build-core
dependent_to.description:
scikit-build-core is a doubly improved build system generator for
CPython C/C++/Fortran/Cython extensions. It features several
improvements over the classic scikit-build build system generator.

dependent_to.name: tiramisu
dependent_to.description:
Tiramisu is a polyhedral compiler for dense and sparse deep learning and
data parallel algorithms.It provides a simple C++ API for expressing
algorithms and how these algorithms should be optimized by the compiler.

dependent_to.name: py-awkward-cpp
dependent_to.description:
py-awkward-cpp provides precompiled routines for the py-awkward package.
It is not useful on its own, only as a dependency for py-awkward.

dependent_to.name: py-libsonata
dependent_to.description: SONATA files reader

dependent_to.name: halide
dependent_to.description:
Halide is a programming language designed to make it easier to write
high-performance image and array processing code on modern machines.

dependent_to.name: py-pennylane-lightning
dependent_to.description:
The PennyLane-Lightning plugin provides a fast state-vector simulator
written in C++.

dependent_to.name: pygmo
dependent_to.description:
Parallel Global Multiobjective Optimizer (and its Python alter ego
PyGMO) is a C++ / Python platform to perform parallel computations of
optimisation tasks (global and local) via the asynchronous generalized
island model.

dependent_to.name: fenics
dependent_to.description:
FEniCS is organized as a collection of interoperable components that
together form the FEniCS Project. These components include the problem-
solving environment DOLFIN, the form compiler FFC, the finite element
tabulator FIAT, the just-in-time compiler Instant / Dijitso, the code
generation interface UFC, the form language UFL and a range of
additional components.

dependent_to.name: mivisionx
dependent_to.description:
MIVisionX toolkit is a set of comprehensive computer vision and machine
intelligence libraries, utilities, and applications bundled into a
single toolkit.

dependent_to.name: qoz
dependent_to.description:
Quality optimized version of SZ3 is the next generation of the SZ
compressor framework

dependent_to.name: py-pynvtx
dependent_to.description:
A thin python wrapper for the nvToolsExt (NVTX) library, using pybind11.
This wrapper is meant to be as thin as possible -- so only provides
minimal support. Currently supported features are: NVTX annotations:
nvtxRangePushA and nvtxRangePop Function decorator: PyNVTX.annotate
Automatic decorator generation PyNVTX.annotate_all_methods()

dependent_to.name: simsipm
dependent_to.description:
SimSiPM is a simple and easy to use C++ library providing a set of
object-oriented tools with all the functionality needed to describe and
simulate Silicon PhotonMultipliers (SiPM) sensors.

dependent_to.name: scine-database
dependent_to.description:
The SCINE database module is a database wrapper for a MongoDB encoding
reaction networks.

dependent_to.name: py-pennylane-lightning-kokkos
dependent_to.description:
The PennyLane-Lightning-Kokkos plugin provides a fast state-vector
simulator with Kokkos kernels.

dependent_to.name: spectre
dependent_to.description:
The SpECTRE numerical relativity code. SpECTRE is an open-source code
for multi-scale, multi-physics problems in astrophysics and
gravitational physics. In the future, we hope that it can be applied to
problems across discipline boundaries in fluid dynamics, geoscience,
plasma physics, nuclear physics, and engineering. It runs at petascale
and is designed for future exascale computers. SpECTRE is being
developed in support of our collaborative Simulating eXtreme Spacetimes
(SXS) research program into the multi-messenger astrophysics of neutron
star mergers, core-collapse supernovae, and gamma-ray bursts.

dependent_to.name: py-onnx
dependent_to.description:
Open Neural Network Exchange (ONNX) is an open ecosystem that empowers
AI developers to choose the right tools as their project evolves. ONNX
provides an open source format for AI models, both deep learning and
traditional ML. It defines an extensible computation graph model, as
well as definitions of built-in operators and standard data types.
Currently we focus on the capabilities needed for inferencing (scoring).

dependent_to.name: openimageio
dependent_to.description:
OpenImageIO is a library for reading and writing images, and a bunch of
related classes, utilities, and applications.
